Arzelà-Ascoli

Define

I(f)=∫01(12(f′(x))2+sin⁡(f(x))+f4(x)) dxI\p{f} = \int_0^1 \p{\frac{1}{2} \p{f'\p{x}}^2 + \sin\p{f\p{x}} + f^4\p{x}} \,\diff{x}I(f)=∫01​(21​(f′(x))2+sin(f(x))+f4(x))dx

for any f∈C1([0,1];R)f \in C^1\p{\br{0,1}; \R}f∈C1([0,1];R). Let fn∈C1([0,1];R)f_n \in C^1\p{\br{0,1}; \R}fn​∈C1([0,1];R) be such that

I(fn)→∫f∈C1([0,1];R)I(f).I\p{f_n} \to \int_{f \in C^1\p{\br{0,1}; \R}} I\p{f}.I(fn​)→∫f∈C1([0,1];R)​I(f).

Show that the sequence {fn}\set{f_n}{fn​} has a limit point in the space C([0,1];R)C\p{\br{0,1}; \R}C([0,1];R).
Solution.

First, observe that {I(fn)}n\set{I\p{f_n}}_n{I(fn​)}n​ is bounded by some M>0M > 0M>0, and so

∫0112(f′(x))2−1+f4(x) dx≤I(f)≤M  ⟹  12∥f′∥L22+∥f∥L44≤M+1,\int_0^1 \frac{1}{2}\p{f'\p{x}}^2 - 1 + f^4\p{x} \,\diff{x} \leq I\p{f} \leq M \implies \frac{1}{2} \norm{f'}_{L^2}^2 + \norm{f}_{L^4}^4 \leq M + 1,∫01​21​(f′(x))2−1+f4(x)dx≤I(f)≤M⟹21​∥f′∥L22​+∥f∥L44​≤M+1,

so the {fn′}n\set{f_n'}_n{fn′​}n​ are uniformly bounded in L2([0,1])L^2\p{\br{0,1}}L2([0,1]) and the {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ are uniformly bounded in L4([0,1])L^4\p{\br{0,1}}L4([0,1]). Hence, given any x,y∈[0,1]x, y \in \br{0, 1}x,y∈[0,1], we have

∣fk(x)−fk(y)∣≤∫[x,y]∣fk′(t)∣ dt≤∥fk′∥L2∣x−y∣1/2≤(sup⁡n ∥fn′∥L2)∣x−y∣1/2,\abs{f_k\p{x} - f_k\p{y}} \leq \int_{\br{x,y}} \abs{f_k'\p{t}} \,\diff{t} \leq \norm{f_k'}_{L^2} \abs{x - y}^{1/2} \leq \p{\sup_n \,\norm{f_n'}_{L^2}} \abs{x - y}^{1/2},∣fk​(x)−fk​(y)∣≤∫[x,y]​∣fk′​(t)∣dt≤∥fk′​∥L2​∣x−y∣1/2≤(nsup​∥fn′​∥L2​)∣x−y∣1/2,

and the constant is independent of nnn by our first estimate. In particular, {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ is equicontinuous. Similarly, by Hölder's inequality,

∥fk∥L1≤∥fk∥L4≤sup⁡n ∥fn∥L4and∥fk′∥L1≤∥fk′∥L2≤sup⁡n ∥fn′∥L2.\norm{f_k}_{L^1} \leq \norm{f_k}_{L^4} \leq \sup_n \,\norm{f_n}_{L^4} \quad\text{and}\quad \norm{f_k'}_{L^1} \leq \norm{f_k'}_{L^2} \leq \sup_n \,\norm{f_n'}_{L^2}.∥fk​∥L1​≤∥fk​∥L4​≤nsup​∥fn​∥L4​and∥fk′​∥L1​≤∥fk′​∥L2​≤nsup​∥fn′​∥L2​.

Hence,

∣fk(x)∣≤∣fk(y)∣+∫[x,y]∣fk′(t)∣ dt  ⟹  ∣fk(x)∣≤∥fk∥L1+∥fk′∥L1≤sup⁡n (∥fn∥L1+∥fn′∥L1)\begin{gathered} \abs{f_k\p{x}} \leq \abs{f_k\p{y}} + \int_{\br{x,y}} \abs{f_k'\p{t}} \,\diff{t} \\ \implies \abs{f_k\p{x}} \leq \norm{f_k}_{L^1} + \norm{f_k'}_{L^1} \leq \sup_n \,\p{\norm{f_n}_{L^1} + \norm{f_n'}_{L^1}} \end{gathered}∣fk​(x)∣≤∣fk​(y)∣+∫[x,y]​∣fk′​(t)∣dt⟹∣fk​(x)∣≤∥fk​∥L1​+∥fk′​∥L1​≤nsup​(∥fn​∥L1​+∥fn′​∥L1​)​

by integrating in yyy. Thus, the {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ are pointwise bounded, so because [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1] is compact, we may apply Arzelà-Ascoli. Thus, {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ admits a limit point in C([0,1];R)C\p{\br{0,1}; \R}C([0,1];R), which was what we wanted to show.
